description.narrative: An expanded partnership alliance is engaged in promoting inclusive child rights agenda at all levels

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

Republic of Turkmenistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: An expanded partnership alliance is engaged in promoting inclusive child rights agenda at all levels

description.narrative: The partnership alliances in promoting inclusive child rights continued with Parliament as well as through State Committee for TV, Radio Broadcasting and Cinematography and Women's Union and with Health Information Centre of the Ministry of Health and Medical Industry. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of people reached on UNICEF social media channels
Number of people reached through offline events, campaigns, C4D

baseline.value: 7,000 (events, C4D, initiatives, conference, workshops, training, campaigns, meetings)

title.narrative: COs C4D efforts to develop and fund behavior and social change strategies in priority areas.

target.value: 2020:The implementation of the C4D Strategy continues, focusing specifically on: (1)radio programmes and feedback on them; (2) Provision of support to the Ministry of Health for design and implementation of C4D-related components of the strategies related mother and newborn care, nutrition and development (3) adaptation process of the Interpersonal Communication for frontline workers, and (4) Emergency and Risk Communication targeting COVID-19.

actual.value: 2020:The C4D Strategy was rolled out to complement programmatic priorities pertaining specifically to ECD. Radio programmes were initiated in 2019 on all four major radio channels. The feedback on radio programmes will be carried out together with Women's Union representatives throughout the country in

title.narrative: C4D support for upstream programmme/policy advocacy on priority behaviors and social norms meets quality standards

baseline.value: Level 2, C4D Support to upstream programme/ policy advocacy on priority behaviors and social norms is characterized by evidence-based advocacy such as 2015 KAP on child rearing practices, MICS5, consultations with children child rights, and other data to advance the child rights agenda for all children, including CWD

target.value: 2020:Level 3: C4D Support to upstream programme/ policy advocacy on priority behaviors and social norms is characterized by the following: (1) evidence-based (Youth SitAn, 2019 MICS, ECD evaluation); (2) more equity-based (ECD campaign and fathers

actual.value: 2020:Level 3 (partially): The C4D strategy, developed in 2018, continued to be implemented, specifically focusing on radio programmes on ECD, inputs to the development of the new strategy on maternal, newborn and adolescent health as well as through the renewal of contacts with organizations like Women's

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

baseline.value: Score 1 - UNICEF is planning to start generating evidence to support budget allocation/expenditure for child related outcomes

target.value: 2020:Score 1.5 - UNICEF and the Government have generated evidence to support budget allocation/expenditure by completing the Health sector budget analysis, even if the data to inform the analysis is limited. Initial steps to conduct costing of the National RMNCAH Strategy costing for 2020-2030 or its selected elements are taken. However, it is not expected that the advocacy efforts will result in improved budget yet.

actual.value: 2019:Initial consultations with the key partners took place on PF4C and results-based budgeting. The work on health budget analysis continues. Its quality is very much dependent on whether the requested data will be shared by the Government. Due to the delay in data provision by the Ministry of Health an

title.narrative: Availability of the revamped CO website

target.value: 2020:English, Turkmen and Russian versions of the CO website are launched and updated regularly

actual.value: 2020:By end 2019, 95% of the site has been developed. It is expected that the website will be launched by early January 2020.
